Multiclass Feats

Multiclass feats allow you to dabble in the class features and powers of another class. You might be a fighter who dips his toe into wizardry, or a warlock who wants a smattering of rogue abilities. Each class has a class-specific multiclass feat that gives you access to features from that class.

Class-Specific Feats
     There are two restrictions on your choice of a class-specific multiclass feat. First, you can't take a multiclass feat for your own class. Second, once you take a multiclass feat, you can't take a class-specific feat for a different class. You can dabble in a second class but not a third. A character who has taken a class-specific multiclass feat counts as a member of that class for the purpose of meeting prerequisites for taking other feats and qualifying for paragon paths. For example, a character who takes Initiate of the Faith counts as a cleric for the purpose of selecting feats that have cleric as a prerequisite. These feats can qualify you for other feats; for example, a warlock who takes Sneak of Shadows can use the rogue's Sneak Attack class feature, which means that he meets the prerequisite for the Backstabber feat.

Weapon mastery training feats like Bola Training [Multiclass Bola] require a great deal of focused training, so each one is considered a multiclass feat. Normal rules for selecting multiclass feats apply.



Published in Player's Handbook, page(s) 208, Dragon Magazine 368 page(s) 66.
